main event: On 17 November 1948, two USAF pilots observed an irregular mass in the sky resembling a flak burst connected to a corkscrew trail, at approximately 30,000 feet above Clark Air Force Base in the Philippines.
interesting points: The sighting lasted about three minutes and appeared as if an aircraft had exploded, leaving a white smoke column., The object was described as white in color and did not resemble a typical vapor trail., The trail was estimated to extend between 1 to 10 miles in length., It was reported that the surrounding sky was clear with no clouds in the vicinity., The sighting was evaluated as a C-3 incident, indicating it was deemed of low significance.
sighted object: irregular mass with a corkscrew smoke trail
witness description: 1st Lt. and 1st Lt. from the 44th Fighter Squadron, 18th Fighter Group.
